description: From Latin draco (“dragon”)  +‎ -tic. Cognate with draconic.

adjectives.description: draconitic (comparative more draconitic, superlative most draconitic)

entries.meaning: Of or pertaining to the nodal period.
examples: The periods between successive nodes has, over time, been termed the dracontic, draconic and draconitic month, the words deriving from the Greek for 'dragon'.

entries.meaning: Relating to or suggestive of dragons.
